Recommended readings to everyone who is interested about Economics, Data Science and Human Geography.

# Economics

1. Mas-Colell, A., M. Whinston and J. Green (1995) Microeconomic theory. Oxford 

2. Sundram, R. (1996) A first course in optimization theory. Cambridge 

3. Friedman, D. (1994) Experimental methods: A primer for economists. Cambridge university press 

4. Gibbons, R. (1992) Game theory for applied economists. Princeton university press 

5. Wooldridge, J. (2019) Introductory econometrics: A modern approach. Cengage learning 

6. Wooldridge, J. (2010) Econometric analysis of cross section and panel data. MIT press 

7. Angrist, J. and J. Pischke (2009) Mostly harmless econometrics: An empiricist's companion. Princeton university press

# Mathmatics

1. Thomas, G., J. Hass, C. Heil and M. Weir (2018) Thomas' calculus. Pearson

2. Rice, J. (2013) Mathematical statistics and data analyis. Cengage learning

# Data Science

1. Wickham, H., and Grolemund, G. (2016). [R for data science: import, tidy, transform, visualize, and model data](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/index.html). O'Reilly Media, Inc.

2. Llaudet, E., and Imai, K. (2022). [Data Analysis for Social Science: A Friendly and Practical Introduction](https://press.princeton.edu/books/hardcover/9780691199429/data-analysis-for-social-science). Princeton University Press.

3. Imai, K. (2017) [Quantitative social science: An introduction](https://press.princeton.edu/books/paperback/9780691175461/quantitative-social-science). Princeton university press

4.  Wickham, H., Navarro, D., and Pedersen, T. (2023) [ggplot2: Elegant Graphics for Data Analysis (3e)](https://ggplot2-book.org/).

5. Heiss, F. (2016). [Using R for introductory econometrics](http://www.urfie.net/?fbclid=IwAR0Iax1Am67ZTTUmaCf_zE7ObMVrcAZ-2hEsuJMErMCyi3qvlQ4WC9wttbI). DÃ¼sseldorf, Germany: Florian Heiss.

# Human Geography

1. Lovelace, R., Nowosad, J., & Muenchow, J. (2019). [Geocomputation with R](https://r.geocompx.org/index.html). CRC Press.

2. Comber, L., & Brunsdon, C. (2020). Geographical data science and spatial data analysis: an introduction in R. Sage.

3. Kopczewska, K. (2020). Applied spatial statistics and econometrics: data analysis in R. Routledge.
